slangs.meaning: Originally meaning 'to be yourself and not care about how others view you', now used to indicate agreement, especially in political discussions
examples: That's a **based** opinion
Your take on this is so **based**

slangs.meaning: The state of losing touch with the real world from consuming hyperstimulating or chronically online content
examples: TikTok gave me **brainrot**
All these memes are pure **brainrot**

slangs.meaning: Extremely good or excellent, especially used for food. Originated from African-American vernacular
examples: This pizza is **bussin**!
The new restaurant's food is straight **bussin**

slangs.meaning: Agreement or affirmation
examples: Are you coming to the party? – **Bet**!
**Bet**, I'll see you there at 8

slangs.meaning: To lie or be dishonest
examples: He said he's rich, but that's **cap**
Stop **capping** about where you were last night

slangs.meaning: Being indisputably caught doing something wrong, referencing high-definition 4K video quality
examples: You were **caught in 4K** lying about that
Man got **caught in 4K** stealing from the store

slangs.meaning: Short for delusional, someone who holds unrealistic or overly idealistic beliefs
examples: You're so **delulu** if you think that'll happen
I'm in my **delulu** era right now

slangs.meaning: A period of interests or priorities in one's life
examples: I'm in my fitness **era**
This is my villain **era**

slangs.meaning: When someone takes a portion of your food without asking
examples: He took a **fanum tax** from my fries
No **fanum tax** on my food please

slangs.meaning: Extremely impressive, good, or cool
examples: That new song is straight **fire**!
Your outfit is **fire** today

slangs.meaning: Something that's uniquely better in a particular context or situation
examples: Water at 3am **hits different**
This song **hits different** after a breakup

slangs.meaning: Acronym for 'if you know, you know' - used for inside jokes or references
examples: That restaurant at 3am **iykyk**
The way this app crashes... **iykyk**

slangs.meaning: When something or someone constantly occupies your thoughts without effort
examples: That song is **living rent free** in my head
That embarrassing moment is **living rent free** in my mind

slangs.meaning: Someone who acts like they're the star of their own movie or wants to be the center of attention
examples: She's having her **main character** moment
**Main character** energy when I walked in late with coffee

slangs.meaning: The truth, without exaggeration
examples: I finished the whole pizza by myself, **no cap**
**No cap**, this is the best movie I've seen

slangs.meaning: Emphasis on a point being final
examples: That's the best movie of the year, **periodt**
I'm not going to that party, **periodt**

slangs.meaning: Charisma or the ability to attract a romantic partner through charm
examples: His **rizz** game is strong
You got no **rizz** bro

slangs.meaning: A term popularized by the viral [Skibidi Toilet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skibidi_Toilet) series. Often used in meme culture and online content.
examples: That video is giving **skibidi** vibes
The new **skibidi** trend is everywhere

slangs.meaning: To do something exceptionally well or succeed impressively
examples: You really **slayed** that presentation!
Queen, you're **slaying** today

slangs.meaning: A suggestion to go outside and reconnect with reality, usually told to someone who's been online too long
examples: You need to **touch grass**
Bro, **touch grass** please

slangs.meaning: A euphemism for death-related terms, used to avoid content moderation
examples: The character got **unalived** in the movie
Don't **unalive** my character in the game

slangs.meaning: The overall mood or atmosphere
examples: This place has such a chill **vibe**
I'm not feeling the **vibe** here

slangs.meaning: To suddenly stop communicating with someone
examples: She **ghosted** me after our last date
Why did you **ghost** the group chat?

slangs.meaning: Something you want to subtly express
examples: I'm **lowkey** excited about the concert
This restaurant is **lowkey** the best in town

slangs.meaning: Something you want to loudly express
examples: I'm **highkey** obsessed with this new album
**Highkey** want to skip work today

slangs.meaning: Suspicious or questionable
examples: That deal sounds kind of **sus** to me
The way they're acting is **sus**

slangs.meaning: To show off
examples: He's always **flexing** his new shoes
Weird **flex** but okay

slangs.meaning: As a verb: to dance casually to music, especially pop music. As a noun: a really good song that makes you want to dance or move. The term has evolved in Gen Z culture to describe any catchy or enjoyable song, regardless of genre.
examples: Everyone was **bopping** to the new Taylor Swift song
This new Drake track is such a **bop**
Just sitting in my room **bopping** to my favorite playlist

slangs.meaning: A dedicated fan of someone or something
examples: I **stan** her work ethic so much
We're all **stanning** this new artist

slangs.meaning: Win or success
examples: Getting that job was a big **W** for me
That presentation was a **W**

slangs.meaning: Loss or failure
examples: Missing that opportunity was such an **L**
Taking the wrong bus was an **L**

slangs.meaning: Someone who does too much for someone they like
examples: He's **simping** hard for her with those gifts
Stop **simping** and focus on yourself

slangs.meaning: Stylish or fashionable clothing/accessories
examples: Check out his **drip**; he's looking fresh
The **drip** is immaculate today

slangs.meaning: To throw something with force
examples: He **yeeted** the ball across the field
Just **yeet** it in the trash

slangs.meaning: Something exciting or excellent
examples: The party last night was **lit**!
This game is absolutely **lit**

slangs.meaning: Evidence or proof of something
examples: I have **receipts** to prove what happened
Show me the **receipts** or it didn't happen

slangs.meaning: Gossip or juicy information
examples: Spill the **tea** on what happened last night
This **tea** is piping hot

slangs.meaning: Someone who is attractive
examples: He's looking like a **snack** in that outfit
You're not just a **snack**, you're the whole meal

slangs.meaning: Something that's very embarrassing
examples: That awkward fall was a **big yikes**
**Big yikes** to that failed presentation

slangs.meaning: Being shocked or surprised
examples: I'm **shook** by that plot twist!
That news has me **shook**

slangs.meaning: Luxurious or high-class
examples: She's always acting **boujee** with her designer bags
This restaurant is too **boujee** for me

slangs.meaning: Over the top or excessive behaviour
examples: Her birthday party decorations were so **extra**
You're being **extra** about this whole situation

slangs.meaning: Everything is good or cool
examples: I'm feeling **gucci** about the project
We're **gucci**, no worries

slangs.meaning: Bitter or upset over something minor
examples: He's **salty** because he lost the game
Don't be **salty** just because I got the promotion

slangs.meaning: Influence or fame, especially on social media
examples: People are always chasing **clout** on Instagram
He's just doing it for the **clout**

slangs.meaning: To talk excessively or ramble about unimportant things. Popularized on TikTok in 2023. Someone who talks too much is called a "yapper".
examples: She just keeps **yapping** about her weekend plans
Bro is such a **yapper**, I can't get any work done

slangs.term: put the fries in the bag
slangs.meaning: A phrase used to tell someone to stop talking unnecessarily and just do what they're supposed to do. Originated from fast-food experiences where workers would talk too much instead of completing the order.
examples: He kept talking about his gaming setup during the meeting and I had to tell him to **put the fries in the bag**
Just **put the fries in the bag**, we don't need your life story

slangs.meaning: An [onomatopoeia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Onomatopoeia) that went viral from a [2024 YouTube street interview](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hawk_tuah). Often used as a sound effect or reaction in social media content.
examples: The comments are just filled with **hawk tuah**
Everyone keeps commenting **hawk tuah** on their videos

slangs.meaning: While traditionally meaning the energy or atmosphere someone exudes, Gen Z uses this term to describe someone's coolness, perceived power, or sense of mystery. Often used to compliment someone's overall vibe or presence.
examples: She's got that main character **aura**
The way he handled that situation... his **aura** is immaculate

slangs.meaning: A phrase used to encourage allowing someone to continue what they're doing without interruption, especially when they're in their element or showing potential. Often used in sports and creative contexts to mean 'don't interrupt' or 'let them do their thing'.
examples: The rookie's on fire, just **let him cook**
When he started his weird dance moves, everyone was laughing, but I said '**let him cook**' and he won the competition

slangs.meaning: To be defeated or embarrassed, especially in a competitive setting. Often implies the defeat was particularly brutal or humiliating. Commonly used in sports contexts.
examples: He tried to guard the star player one-on-one and **got cooked**
That debate team **got cooked** in the finals, it wasn't even close

slangs.meaning: A state where someone has lost their former abilities or can no longer perform at their previous level. Often used to describe athletes or competitors who are past their prime.
examples: That player **is cooked**, he's not the same since his injury
The champion **is cooked**, it's time for him to retire

slangs.meaning: A state of complete focus and dedication to a task or goal. For Gen Z, it represents more than just commitment—it's about channeling all your energy, attention, and effort into something important, often with an almost meditative level of concentration.
examples: I'm **locked in** this weekend to finish my portfolio
He's been **locked in** at the gym for months and the results are showing
Can't hang out tonight, need to stay **locked in** on this project deadline

slangs.meaning: A phrase expressing extreme disbelief or being dumbfounded by something unexpected or hard to believe. Often used in online spaces or social media when witnessing something particularly shocking or surprising. The 'chat' refers to the audience or community being addressed.
examples: When the underdog team scored in the last second: '**chat is this real**??'
Seeing their favorite artist show up at a small venue: '**chat is this real** right now?'
After witnessing an impossible play in a game: 'Bro **chat is this real**, did that just happen?'

slangs.meaning: Short for 'Non-Player Character' from video games, used metaphorically to describe someone who seems to lack independent thought or agency. It suggests someone who blindly follows trends, repeats common phrases without understanding them, or behaves in a predictable, programmed way like background characters in a game.
examples: She just repeats whatever is trending on TikTok, total **NPC** behavior
The way they all dress exactly the same and say the same phrases, they're like **NPCs**
Stop being an **NPC** and think for yourself

slangs.meaning: A dismissive phrase used to mock or reject outdated attitudes typically associated with the baby boomer generation (people born between 1946-1964). The phrase became a popular [internet meme](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OK_boomer) representing younger generations' frustration with perceived condescension and resistance to change from older generations.
examples: When he complained about kids always being on their phones, I just replied '**OK boomer**'
He gave a lecture about how we're too sensitive these days and everyone just typed '**OK boomer**' in the comments
Their response to climate change concerns was met with collective '**OK boomer**' reactions

slangs.meaning: Short for 'Top Gangster', a term popularized by Andrew Tate to describe someone who commands respect and admiration. While originally meant to convey dominance and authority, it's now often used casually among friends as a form of greeting or compliment.
examples: What's up **Top G**! Haven't seen you in ages!
My man just aced all his exams, true **Top G** behavior right there
He handled that situation like a real **Top G**

slangs.meaning: Short for 'Original Gangster', a term of respect used to describe someone who's been around for a long time and has earned respect through experience. In modern usage, it can refer to anything that's authentic, original, or pioneering in its field.
examples: He's an **OG** in the rap game, been making hits since the 90s
Respect to the **OG**, he taught me everything I know about coding
That's the **OG** version of the game, before all the remakes

slangs.meaning: Refers to diamonds or other expensive jewelry, particularly when they're very shiny or flashy. Often used in phrases like 'iced out' to describe someone wearing lots of diamond jewelry.
examples: His new chain is straight **ice**, must have cost a fortune
Man's completely **iced out** with that new watch and rings
The rapper showed up with his neck full of **ice**

slangs.meaning: Describes something that has an unexpectedly strong positive impact or feels especially good in a particular moment or context.
examples: Late night music really **hits different**
Mom's cooking **hits different** when you're away at college
That song **hits different** after a breakup

slangs.meaning: Fashionable, extremely stylish, or trendy appearance, particularly in clothing and accessories. Someone with 'drip' has great style.
examples: His new outfit is pure **drip**
Look at his **drip**, man's never misses with the fits
She got that expensive **drip**, designer everything

slangs.meaning: A tongue posture technique popularized by Dr. Mike Mew, which involves placing the tongue against the roof of the mouth to allegedly improve facial structure and jawline. Became viral on social media platforms like TikTok with GenZ pursuing aesthetic facial features.
examples: Been **mewing** for 6 months and my jawline is getting sharper
Everyone on TikTok is talking about **mewing** for better facial structure
The gym bros are all about **mewing** and proper tongue posture now

slangs.meaning: Something that is exceptionally good or amazing, often used to describe music that has a strong impact or makes you want to move or dance
examples: Rihanna's new single **slaps** so hard, I can't stop listening to it!
This beat **slaps**
The DJ's playlist **slaps** tonight
